history.narrative: Law 1-128, the “Nuisance Elimination Act of 1976,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 1-303, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 23, 1976, and December 7, 1976, respectively. Enacted without signature by the Mayor on January 19, 1977, it was assigned Act No. 1-222 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
